message: That's good to see. I actually hadn't realized until just a few days ago that Facebook supported this same setup. I just happened to be going through the settings and stumbled upon it.
Should have been done a long time ago. Glad they've started doing it now.
The tweet that triggered it:  "@cdine: New Twitter HTTPS option fragile. delete secure_session cookie [sslstrip], make https req, _twitter_sess re-issued as not secure, owned."
Some critical thoughts on that by this InfoSec guy: http://twitter.com/cdine
